source.name: Asset Tokenization: Applications and Characteristics
source.instructions: Which of the following statements accurately describe applications or characteristics of asset tokenization? Select all that apply.

answers.answer: Real-world assets like gold bullion and house deeds can be tokenized and stored on a blockchain
Tokenized digital assets always represent a claim on an underlying physical asset
In-game assets in GameFi projects can be represented as tokenized assets
Asset tokenization enables fractional ownership of traditionally indivisible assets
Tokenized assets can only be traded within a single blockchain network

source.guidance: This question assesses understanding of various applications and characteristics of asset tokenization. The correct options highlight key aspects: the ability to tokenize real-world assets, the tokenization of purely digital assets (including in-game assets), and the potential for fractional ownership. The incorrect options address common misconceptions: not all tokenized digital assets represent claims on physical assets, and tokenized assets can often be traded across different blockchain networks. This question encourages critical thinking about the diverse applications and features of asset tokenization in both physical and digital contexts.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT analyze different applications and characteristics of asset tokenization
